comments.commentBody: The Russia connection is interesting and somewhat disturbing. Personally, I'm much more concerned about the deep ties between the 45th Administration and all of the Alt-Right groups that seem to think that the election gave them a green-light to attack the people that they blame for all their problems. After all, the Alt-Right folks are right here and do pose a clear and present danger to all of us.

replies.commentBody: Perhaps that is a behavior learned from Mitch O'Connell and the Republicans under Obama.

Yes. Just like the 8 years of obstruction brought on by the Republicans. The hissy fit over the emails. The acceptance of the birther claims. The openess of proclaiming their number one priority was that Obama would only serve one term.

Yes, no sacrifice is too great.

comments.commentBody: The Democrats just will not accept that Trump is the elected President. No sacrifice is to great to sate their hate and "outrage". Drag the country down the tubes, re-start the cold war, obstruct any chance of cooperation on moving the country in a positive direction. "Sad" and very disappointing but not that surprising really.

2018:

With the scandal plagued White House continuing it's full denial, backed by a Congress which refuses to investigate, and the nation sliding into recession, Americans go to the polls. History looms large not favoring the incumbent, but this time seems special, the mass protests, the slow peel of GOP leaders expressing views counter to the administration, the calls of treason on the Senate floor, Jewish, Muslim, Latino and black places of worship destroyed, the loss of health care for millions, tax cuts skewed to the rich, and open fighting with our key allies, all have the nation at a boiling point.

It will be the highest turnout in a midterm ever.

This is such a huge deal. If the status quo with this new administration persists, then we are doomed as a nation. It is untenable at this point for Republicans to pretend there is no need for an investigation. If Trump comes out talking about fake news, it will be clear this is no longer simply about fact or fiction.
It is an independent and free press that is our saving grace. Every dropping shoe should be keeping citizens up at night. Coordination and collusion?
This is our democracy at stake.

The full picture is finally becoming clearer.

Obama operatives within the government are pushing an anti-Trump agenda by selectively leaking misleading information “anonymously” to a the anti-Trump media. Ben Rhodes is smiling, for now.

As a member of the Senate Armed Services Committee, Sessions met briefly with the Russian ambassador…just like he met with the ambassadors from dozens of other countries.

Flynn talked with a Russian government official during the transition, knowing that he was being monitored, and at most told him that the Trump Administration would pursue better relations once in office. His only problem was lying to Pence, which was sufficient reason to sack him.

Page and Manafort were bit players who had contacts with Russia dating back to Obama’s efforts to promote better relations there.

In the end, the FBI will investigate and release its findings. They won’t amount to a hill of beans. Yet, the Democrats will pursue this line of attack to subtly undermine Trump. It seems the Democrats need their very own “birther” issue to keep their based riled up.

More smears incubated by bitter Obama supporters who have been running around Washington emailing reporters and conducting a whispering campaign against the Trump Administration. Plenty of Democrats and Republicans meet with Russian Diplomats on a yearly basis in their capacity as representatives. It is common. Now angry and bitter Clinton supporters are trying to put a dark spin on this practice to undermine President Trump.

Trump has been trying to discredit the press and gone unbelievably as far as to say that the press is the enemy of the people.  Why?  Because he fears that the press eventually with damming evidence will expose his Russian connections.

It is so clear to me. The man has never ever said a bad thing about Russia. When in our history has that happened? There is nothing forthcoming from this administration regarding looking into any allegations at all-there there? His son has admitted to Russian-Trump business ties, and still conflict of interest exists. He is the same ego maniac as he has always been.

That display the other night didn't fool me. What is worse is the whole party is behind him. Disgusting.

I will patiently await for our true patriots of intelligence to reveal the truth. The men and women who work tirelessly to keep our country secure, no matter who is in the Oval. They have seen this movie before, they know the ending. I have my popcorn.

I don't understand why U.S. Intelligence officials' evidence that Russia did indeed interfere with the 2016 Presidential campaign doesn't alarm every member of Congress as well as the majority of the American public. After the myriad articles, investigations and debates over the "risk" of Hilary Clinton's emails you would think actual evidence of hacking and other acts would compel our legislators to investigate. But no! Instead, we see the real motivating principle behind GOP senators and House members: Party over Country. I despair for our nation, but am thankful for the strategy employed to preserve this evidence. And especially thankful to the NYTIMES in reporting it.

replies.commentBody: Did you not read or see Sessions' response to a direct question? If the now Attorney General of the United States (or any Senator) lies in response to a direct question under oath, then intellectually ALL should be concerned. Do you really want someone who has circumvented the truth as head of the Department of Justice. Anyway you look at it, that dog don't hunt.

comments.commentBody: The democrats are powerless. This is their only way to stop his agenda. Unelected Obama bureaucrats are at war with this administration. They need to be rooted out and prosecuted. Lets be intellectually honest with each other. Putin owned, embarrassed, and played Obama for 8 years. The sanctions were a tool to undermine Trumps ability to work with Russia in any capacity and the finger to Putin out the door.

As millions of Americans face their annual test of honesty toward the federal government with the filing of their tax returns, the Attorney General has failed his own test.  The Average Joe will be called to account for his dishonesty with threats of fines and/or incarceration, even if the infraction is an honest mistake. Sessions, on the other hand, will be left free to prosecute others for their dishonesty.  This is why we are losing faith in our institutions.

It's a shame Obama did not go this trouble to aid in the investigations of his own administration. I suppose though that on the opposite side of his efforts to preserve information on this, he was probably also busy destroying information on his own scandals. I had always hoped that the next administration could dig a little deeper in the rigging of the 2012 Presidential election by the IRS or Obama supplying guns to the Mexican cartels.

Mathew,Adam and Michael,thank you for this nice article.

But what I don't understand is that how long Trump's core supporters will look the other way to this very damning news about Russian contacts with the Trump campaign aides inside our country as well as in many countries of Europe.

I understand Mr. Trump had a distinctive advantage over Hillary as most of his supporters were and still are uneducated or under-educated and thus not intelligent enough to parse the truth from falsehood like the way we in the Democratic party could just deduce by just looking at Trump and said he was a phony.

Actually people like Trump couldn't even get the job of mowing the grass in the D.N.C. Headquarters in Washington.

So the idea of a racist con-man and snake oil salesman running on a Democratic ticket would've been nipped in the bud by our Democratic party members.

With such vulgar pronouncements calling horrible names to the people of Mexicans who are part and parcel of our electorate, would've been a no-no from the beginning with any presidential candidate using such moniker to describe a group of people who're doing nothing but a great work to keep our country clean and healthy through their productive and innocent life styles.

But for the racist Republican party members Trump was and still a hero.

They didn't go deep into Trump's words.

They just listened what he said.

Because this is how they grew up in their racist households .

So they voted for their racist president.

Gratitude is due: To people who continue to honor their promise to preserve, protect, and defend the United States we owe thanks.

Our country belongs to all of us, not Team Putin, not Team Trump, not a handful of billionaires, but to the homeless as well as the well-healed. May more stalwart souls join the effort to keep us safe from threats originating within and outside the borders of our chosen home.

replies.commentBody: It really doesn't appear that Trump has any actual ability to govern.

It may be politically smart for a party that wants to return to power, but it certainly undermines the operation of our government, which the dems appear to be willing to sacrifice in their desire to win by any means necessary.

comments.commentBody:
The Progressives "seem" to be using their cache of information on Donald Trump strategically. There is no sense bombarding the media with the 15-20 major scandals at the same time. Trying to eat up Trumps ability to govern by constantly using his long list of outrageous attacks on the Constitution, the corruption levels of his businesses, the massive amount of incompetence by introducing them one by one and allowing us to look at them in detail and allowing them to discredit his election is very smart. Kellyanne Conway, Michael Flynn, etc being taken out one by one will give us a chance to digest how nauseating his election is becoming. We know that his taxes and many other bombshells are available and will be used to crush him at the right time for the right reason.
No sense in running into the arms of VP Mike Pants ( on fire )

Are there any patriotic Republicans left? They appear to be more like capitalist anarchists. So while this treasonous drama is unfolding they are firing 1 in 5 EPA employees - those that work on low income, minority and indigenous issues. institutionalized environmental racism at its core.

replies.commentBody: No, if Obama had begun investigations when they found the hack back in June, it would have looked like he was deliberately undermining Trump, and hillary would have suffered in the polls. He couldn’t let a transparent search for the truth keep his party from winning the election...

comments.commentBody:
Its a case of damned if you do and damned if you don't. Obama could not have done more than go to Congress, which he did, for them to act. Had he acted himself, it would have looked as if he were interfering in an election that was being interfered with, without much doubt even then, by the Russians. The intelligence community was all over it. All that we have heard about the NSA and it wouldn't have been to work on this? The audacity of the Trump team, is incredible. These actors, in the behalf of Russia, Manafort, Flynn, Stone, etc. were all involved with Russia and had been prior to their selection by Trump to serve on his campaign. Or, was it Putin who selected them to work closely with Trump.

Trump, who says he had no dealings with the Russians, has been doing deals with Russian billionaires for some time. Much of their dirty money has been laundered in NYC in the sale of multi-million dollar sales of apartments. Now, rents everywhere have been impacted by these vacant apartment that tonied up neighborhoods that were once otherwise affordable. Trump LOST New York City by 9:1. It's not just Trump, its also Tillerson. It was also Sessions. There are more. This was hacking. However, the Russians are working to hijack America.

Yesterday, Turmp said that "soon they'll be one party." Is he projecting that he is going to rule as an authoritarian and that his role is to destroy our democratic system? He idolizes Putin?

How much more America? Treason or impeachment.

The issues and suspicions swirling around Russia and Donald Trump's campaign will never go away until there is a complete investigation that is credible to both sides of the aisle.  The questions and suspicions are too great (and continually growing) for Trump to rid himself with dismissive statements or for America to be satisfied.

It has been clear for a long time that Mitch McConnell cares only about Republican control. Paul Ryan too has abandoned his principles. What would convince them to launch a serious investigation, insist that Sessions recuse himself, and appoint a special prosecutor? The fear that they're going to start losing elections.

What is becoming increasingly clear is that the Trump spin cycle that was started last week with his actions agains the media (the barring of the NYT, CNN and others from a press briefing and the public attacks) and his most recent comments on Fox and Friends regarding President Obama being behind the leaks and the protests were preemptive actions to get out in front of this report and discredit the narrative in this particular story.

Given that the exclusion of the press from a seemingly minor press briefing seemed particularly ill-advised and poorly thought out in real time (even for President Trump), I have to believe that even more is known about the Trump/Russia relationship--and that the Trump camp knows that the media has more that is set to come out.

This is not going away anytime soon and has the potential to be deeply dividing if hard, corroborated evidence is not made available to the public. A full and independent investigation into the Trump-Putin relationship would seem appropriate at this point, and would seemingly be in the best interests of both the nation and the Trump administration--if there is no there, there, of course.

Republicans refuse to investigate Putin-ghazi at their peril. This information continues to dribble out while our investigative agencies continue to connect the dots.
When congressional committees don't materialize and special prosecutors aren't appointed the people will note the complicity of the entire Republican party in this sordid affair.

A careful reading of the statements by Mr. Sessions and his spokespersons cited in this news article makes clear that Mr. Sessions is now distinguishing between having met last year with the Russian Ambassador, on the one hand -- a perfectly legitimate exercise in Mr. Sessions' role as a member of the Armed Services Committee -- and having "met with the Russians" -- a formulation with far more sinister implications, given the history of Soviet and Russian espionage against the US and what we now know about Moscow's role in election hacking -- on the other.

In a court of law, a skilled lawyer could reasonably explain the difference to a dubious jury, and Mr. Sessions would be exonerated.

But in the court of public opinion -- specifically, Mr. Sessions' congressional testimony January 10 -- the burden was on Mr. Sessions to come clean and carefully delineate what he did and did not do.

What would have been the harm in admitting to have met the Russian Ambassador at the Heritage Foundation? Even vengeful Democrats would be unable to say that was out of line, given Mr. Sessions role as a Senator.

That he *did not* come clean -- knowing that the topic was on the minds of Congress and the American people -- is what I find most disturbing. Mr. Sessions thought he could get away with ambiguity.

It seems to me that more than anything else, Mr. Sessions' backpedalling is the thread that, when pulled, will unravel this entire nauseating tale of deceit and subterfuge.

I don't understand what this is all about and besides, government have contacts on all levels 24/7/365 -
What anyone says is anyway corrected or amplified with the next administration. If nobody talks to anybody, that's really dangerous.
A country, government, people are all changeable and talking is on-going.
If NYC is the city that never sleeps, then high-end senior officials should not talk to other officials in the world - really ??
Some things should never shut down:
Police Departments
Emergency Services
Hospitals
Government Services .. for starters.
There was a time when Republicans and Democrats went on vacations together, met socially and talked and talked and talked. So what!

The Trump Regime should have no qualms whatsoever if all of this contact were, in deed, on the up-and-up. Various foreign governments commonly do try to, at least, make contact with potential new leaders; but, the question, in this case, remains: how many on Trump's Transition Team made contact; how frequently; with whom and notes should be readily available.

But, with the way that Trump had]s con tally shied away from giving any details--tax returns and foreign business dealings--there just seems to be way too much smoke, not to have a fire.

https://thetruthoncommonsense.com

"All spoke on the condition of anonymity because they were discussing classified information, nearly all of which remains secret, making an independent public assessment of the competing Obama and Trump administration claims impossible."   ---- Based on he two administrations' overall credibility on other matters, the claims from the Obama administration are far more believable.
